import React from 'react'; import './AboutPage.css'; function AboutPage() { return (

About Bowling Simulator

Project Overview

This bowling simulator allows users to simulate bowling games with real

Tech Stack

Frontend

  • React (v19.1.0)
  • React Router (v7.5.0)
  • CSS3 for styling

Backend

  • Node.js
  • Express.js (v5.1.0)
  • RESTful API design
  • CORS for cross-origin requests

Project Structure

Frontend Structure

  • components/ - Reusable UI components
  • pages/ - Page components (Home, Simulation, About)
  • images/ - Static image assets
  • App.js - Main application component with routing

Backend Structure

  • index.js - Express server setup and API endpoints
  • src/components/ - Core game logic components
  • BowlingGame.js - The main game logic implementation

API Endpoints

Endpoint Method Description
/api/simulateRoll POST Simulates a single bowling roll
/api/simulateGame POST Simulates an entire bowling game
/api/resetGame POST Resets the game state
/api/undoRoll POST Undoes the last roll
/api/gameState GET Retrieves the current game state

How It Works

The bowling simulation follows standard bowling rules:

  • A game consists of 10 frames
  • Each frame allows the player up to two rolls to knock down 10 pins
  • A strike (all 10 pins on first roll) earns 10 points plus the value of the next two rolls
  • A spare (all 10 pins using two rolls) earns 10 points plus the value of the next roll
  • The 10th frame allows for up to 3 rolls if a strike or spare is scored

The simulator randomly generates roll values, calculates scores according to bowling rules, and maintains the game state on the server. The frontend communicates with the backend via RESTful API calls to update and display the game state.

); } export default AboutPage;
